text: Guinea competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Guinea entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Mamadou Bah |align=left|50 m freestyle |27.91 |120 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:05.54 |118 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Yaya Yeressa |align=left|50 m breaststroke |34.71 |70 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:19.66 |85 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Mariana Touré |align=left|50 m breaststroke |44.35 |52 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |colspan=2| |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Guinea at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Guinea at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
